title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 01 September 2015 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius\_> has quit  
00:51 <rrodriguez> has quit  
01:46 <Denis1> has quit  
02:13 <ombwa\_> has joined #xwiki  
02:35 <ombwa\_> Hello folks.  My apologies if this is a dump question.  I’m trying out XWiki and am having a devil of a time trying to figure out how to write markdown.  If I search google for “xwiki markdown” I find info on rendering.xwiki.org, which is allegedly included in XWiki Enterprise, but when editing a doc I see a “Document syntax” dropdown that only has 2 options: “XWiki 2.0” and “XWiki 2.1”.  If I search extensions for  
02:35 <ombwa\_> “markdown” or “rendering” I get nothing.  I saw an {{html}} exmaple so I tried {{markdown}} but that doesn’t work.   Can anyone point me in the right direction?

11:43 <mflorea> tmortagne: can we move XWIKI-12457 to 7.2RC1 or have you started working on it?  
11:43 <tmortagne> mflorea: did not started no  
11:44 <mflorea> ok, so I've move it  
11:44 <mflorea> I'll  
11:50 <tmortagne> mflorea: tell me when you are done with the RN, just need to document XWIKI-12464  
11:50 <mflorea> tmortagne: go  
11:50 <tmortagne> thanks  
11:52 <gsmeria1> has quit  
11:53 <tmortagne> mflorea: all yours  
11:53 <mflorea> thanks  
12:00 <tmortagne> we should release a 6.4.5 in not too long IMO but there is a "stable" failing list it seems: org.xwiki.wysiwyg.test.ui.EditWYSIWYGTest.testUndoRepeatedPaste (maybe it rights a bell mflorea)  
12:02 <mflorea> testUndoRepeatedPaste is not a real problem. This test fails on some agents all the time and passes on the rest of the agents all the time. I investigated the test of CI but I couldn't find the difference. Jenkins is configured to try reuse the same agent for a project, so this test fails most of the time  
12:04 <mflorea> the date I put for 6.4.5 in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ is just to display 6.4.5 at the top of the live table  
12:04 <tmortagne> mflorea: I'm not referring to the date in http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleasePlans/ but there is various blockers fixed for this release  
12:04 <mflorea> ok  
12:05 <mflorea> +1 to release 6.4.5 ASAP then  
12:07 <tmortagne> evalica: asking you since you are the next one of RM list, do you fill like releasing 6.4.5 ASAP (not today to not mess with mflorea's release of course) ? It should be an easy one without any surprise :)  
12:08 <tmortagne> no need to execute clirr check for example ;)  
12:10 <vmassol> note: still having lots of problems but I'm getting there…. :)  
12:11 <tmortagne> vmassol: by the ay you forgot to update clirr setup and previous version after 6.4.4 release (you also forgot to update the SNAPSHOT version but I fixed it)  
12:11 <tmortagne> s/ay/way/  
12:11 <vmassol> ah ok… sorry, thanks  
12:11 <vmassol> we need to work on automating more this clirr part of the release  
12:11 <vmassol> it's the most painful now  
12:13 <tmortagne> vmassol: actually we need to work on fixing the automation of this clirr part ;)  
12:13 <vmassol> yes  
12:13 <tmortagne> same for SNAPSHOT version update which does not work anymore  
12:14 <tmortagne> we may need a XWiki Build Day or something  
12:14 <tmortagne> or XWiki Tooling Day  
12:14 <vmassol> right now we have Nested Space Days :)  
12:16 <tmortagne> yes but in general we never had any day related to the release and related tools  
12:16 <tmortagne> s/day/Day/  
12:18 <vmassol> you could add it as an idea here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XWikiDays  
12:20 <tmortagne> sure but I think this one should be put as priority since we push it back since a long time and it would help a lot  
12:21 <vmassol> sure I'm not against it  
12:21 <vmassol> not sure how we share the work though but we can figure something out  
12:31 <Denis1> has quit  
12:47 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
12:52 <evalica> tmortagne: sure - so releasing 6.4.5 after we finish with this release.

13:33 <vmassol> debugging  
13:42 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
13:49 <vmassol> ok I know why  
13:52 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: ping on skype when you're back  
13:53 <vmassol> I'd like to do a review with you of issues I've found when looking at a functional test in platform  
13:53 <vmassol> found 7 issues and I'd like to have your opinion about them  
14:17 <silverdrop> has quit  
14:21 <silverdrop> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <silverdr1p> has joined #xwiki  
14:27 <vmassol> is it normal than in an empty wiki I can edit when not logged in but I cannot delete?  
14:43 <gsmeria> has left #xwiki  
14:45 <tmortagne> vmassol: seems so  
14:45 <tmortagne> according to the setup EDIT is ALLOW by default while delete is DENY by default  
14:46 <tmortagne> ( https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-security/xwiki-platform-security-api/src/main/java/org/xwiki/security/authorization/Right.java#L130 )  
14:53 <evalica> has quit

15:00 <msmeria> has quit

15:29 <tmortagne> [WARN] Restart myxwiki.org on 7.1.2 in 10 minutes  
15:32 <woshilapin> Hi devs, is there any difference between using `@Singleton` and `@InstantiationStrategy(ComponentInstantiationStrategy.SINGLETON)` for components?  
15:36 <vmassol> woshilapin: same but you should use @Singleton  
15:36 <vmassol> the other one is oldish and deprecated now  
15:36 <vmassol> should be indicated in the code  
15:36 <vmassol> gtg for my kine session, bb in 45 mn  
15:38 <woshilapin> Thanks vmassol  
15:39 <tmortagne> [WARN] Restarting myxwiki.org  
15:56 <gdelhumeau> "Add page from office" is missing as explained by mflorea in XWIKI-12189  
16:03 <tmortagne> [ANN] myxwiki.org is now running 7.1.2  
16:53 <gdelhumeau> I've fixed the annotation tests I think  
16:57 <vmassol> back  
16:57 <vmassol> reading  
16:58 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: this fixed the comment and annotation merge?  
16:58 <gdelhumeau> for the merge I'm not sure  
16:58 <gdelhumeau> but the javascript was broken so maybe  
16:58 <vmassol> ok testing but I doubt it fixed the test  
16:59 <vmassol> thanks  
16:59 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: sorry I was talking about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastCompletedBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ui.annotations/AnnotationsTest/AddAndDeleteAnnotations/  
16:59 <gdelhumeau> which is probably the one you are moving?  
16:59 <vmassol> yes but I haven't reached that level yet I think  
17:00 <vmassol> I had all the other problems before :)  
17:18 <ombwa> has joined #xwiki  
17:32 <ombwa> Hello folks.  I’m trying out XWiki and am having a devil of a time trying to figure out how to write in Markdown.  XWiki Rendering supports Markdown and is allegedly included in XWiki Enterprise, but when editing a doc I see a “Document syntax” dropdown that only has 2 options: “XWiki 2.0” and “XWiki 2.1”.  Admin->Edit Mode Settings doesn’t list any more.  Admin->Content doesn’t help.  If I search extensions for  
17:32 <ombwa> “markdown” or “rendering” I get nothing.  I saw an {{html}} exmaple so I tried {{markdown}} but that doesn’t work.   Does XWiki Enterprise actually support Markdown?  
17:33 <ClemensR> ist in the xwiki.cfg on the file system I thuink  
17:35 <ClemensR> xwiki.rendering.syntaxes = xwiki/2.0, xwiki/2.1      ... that is the default value in the WEB-INF/xwiki.cfg  - you need to add markdown there  
17:35 <mflorea> has quit  
17:35 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:35 <ombwa> aha thank you ClemensR  
17:36 <ClemensR> you can add  markdown/1.1   then it should work  
17:36 <ClemensR> or markdown/1.0 for 1.0 ...  
17:38 <vmassol> ombwa: you missed http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing#HChoosingaSyntax :)  
17:40 <ombwa> wmassol: I saw that page.  However my dropdown only has 2 options and it doesn’t give any advice on addiing additonal syntaxes.  
17:40 <vmassol> hmmm  
17:40 <vmassol> so the message on that page is not clear?  
17:40 <vmassol> there is a link to 'configured syntaxes'  
17:41 <vmassol> I'll imrpvoe it now  
17:41 <ombwa> Aha!  That link is not obvious.  
17:42 <ombwa> Apparently visited links on that page are color #23076f.   Tha’s a very dark blue and almost indistinguishable from the default font color.  
17:44 <vmassol> ombwa: is it better now at http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/PageEditing#HChoosingaSyntax ?  
17:44 <vmassol> wait, doing one more improvement  
17:45 <ombwa> vmassol: much better!  Thanks!  Now that’s what I call responsive :)  
17:45 <vmassol> should be even better now ombwa!  
17:46 <vmassol> ofc the best would to allow editing this list at runtime and provide a link to that admin config directly when opening that select box when you're admin for example  
17:48 <vmassol> created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-12474 but no warranty as to when it'll be implemented (possibly in a very long time ;))  
17:55 <vmassol> hmm so today is not going to see the 7.2M3 release :(  
17:56 <vmassol> we're eating time from RC1 which is planned for the 14th of sep (about 10 working days not counting tomorrow)  
17:59 <vmassol> 25 issues open for RC1...  
17:59 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/issues/?jql=fixVersion%20%3D%20%227.2-rc-1%22%20AND%20project%20%3D%20XWIKI%20AND%20resolution%20%3D%20Unresolved%20ORDER%20BY%20priority%20DESC  
17:59 <vmassol> :)  
18:01 <tmortagne> I think I fixed all remaining issue with single annotation edit  
18:03 <vmassol> progressing on my side  
18:03 <vmassol> one anno test out of 2 passing in platform now  
18:04 <vmassol> a new issue just popped up though  
18:06 <tmortagne> if any test is manipulating a single annotation it's probably expecting to failing without what I just committed  
18:06 <tmortagne> s/failing/fail/  
18:06 <vmassol> it's strange  
18:07 <vmassol> I'm logged in as superadmin  
18:07 <vmassol> I tried to ctrl+M  
18:07 <vmassol> I got an error saying i don't have the permissions  
18:07 <vmassol> and then when I try again (after reload) nothing happens  
18:09 <vmassol> (and Annotations doesn't appear anymore in the more actions menu)  
18:09 <vmassol> (even after a restart :))  
18:16 <ombwa> has quit
